document.ModsDocTitle: Polyphyly of the traditional family Flabellinidae affects a major group of Nudibranchia: aeolidacean taxonomic reassessment with descriptions of several new families, genera, and species (Mollusca, Gastropoda)
document.docAuthor: Korshunova, Tatiana, Martynov, Alexander, Bakken, Torkild, Evertsen, Jussi, Fletcher, Karin, Mudianta, I Wayan, Saito, Hiroshi, Lundin, Kennet, Michael Schroedl, & Picton, Bernard
document.docTitle: Pacifia amica Korshunova, Martynov, Bakken, Evertsen, Fletcher, Mudianta, Saito, Lundin, Schroedl & Picton, 2017, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Polyphyly of the traditional family Flabellinidae affects a major group of Nudibranchia: aeolidacean taxonomic reassessment with descriptions of several new families, genera, and species (Mollusca, Gastropoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Polyphyly of the traditional family Flabellinidae affects a major group of Nudibranchia: aeolidacean taxonomic reassessment with descriptions of several new families, genera, and species (Mollusca, Gastropoda)

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype, ZMMU Op-614, 6.5 mm long (live), NE Pacific, Sullivan Point, Rich Passage, 25.01.2017, depth 15.2 m, stones, collector Karin Fletcher. 1 paratype, ZMMU Op-615, same locality and collector as holotype.
See under the genus description above.

Four to five ceratal clusters, colour translucent white with opaque white mid-dorsal line, cerata orange red to light pink, rachidian tooth with up to six denticles, central cusp bears small denticles, distinct distal receptaculum seminis, no accessory penial gland, penis unarmed.
Radula (Fig. 41 F-H ) Radula formula 28 x 0.1.0. Rachidian tooth with up to six distinct denticles. Rachidian cusp bears small denticles at the base (Fig. 41H). No lateral teeth.

Reproductive system (Fig. 41I). Diaulic. Ampulla wide, folded twice (Fig. 41I, am). Prostate thick (Fig. 41I, pr). Vas deferens short (Fig. 41I, vd), penial sheath elongate (Fig. 41I, ps), conical penis unarmed. Distal seminal receptaculum long, with distinct stalk and oval reservoir (Fig. 41I, rsd). Proximal receptaculum seminis oval.
Presently found only at a Port Orchard locality in Washington State, NE Pacific.
See Remarks under the new genus Pacifia above.
